data.text: @Gem_kiss @FluteOld @Covid19Critical No. Actually people who don't take it get well too, more than 98% of them.

@tabonebrake @FluteOld @Covid19Critical 2/ a coincidence tht so many ppl go from being progressively sick, to sudden & total improvement after taking IVM, while those tht don't take it will progress thru the viral replication stage as expected w/ no sudden improvement.

@tabonebrake @FluteOld @Covid19Critical Case studies are included in the body of scientific evidence (or scientific method as u call it) it might not be the gold standard, but when supported by the various other studies all showing similar results @FluteOld can say w/ confidence it worked.
Also, its beyond a... 1/

@tabonebrake @Covid19Critical Sure, all 15 of them (or whatever the current membership is) can pool their savings and are going to come up with half a billion $ to run the study. Your proposal is hilarious.

@tabonebrake @Gem_kiss @Covid19Critical 2/2 I my personal (ancedotal) experience contradicted what the literature said, I would have reason to question the literature. My personal experience, however, happens to agree with what the multiple randomized studies predict - the effectiveness of ivermectin.

@tabonebrake @Gem_kiss @Covid19Critical 1/2 My Ph D thesis, 24 years of teaching internal medicine, & my 100 peer-reviewed publications would say otherwise.
